required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of the Extract of Carica Papaya as an Inhibitor of Streptococcus Mutans
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of the Extract of Carica Papaya as an Inhibitor of Streptococcus Mutans in Students of the Faculty of Dentistry in the Year 2018

brief_summary.textblock: Papaya has effects on oral pathogenic microorganisms, it also has anticoagulant quality, amebicidal action, antimicrobial, bacteriostatic and antifungal activity on different bacteria, especially on Streptococcus mutans, this can be exploited in the dental area. The objective of the study was to determine the efficacy of Carica Papaya peel extract (suckling) as an inhibitor of Streptococcus Mutans in students of the dental faculty of the National University of Caaguazú in 2018.

detailed_description.textblock:
Specific objectives
- To determine the inhibition of the extract of the peel of Carica Papaya (baby) at 3% on Streptococcus Mutans by age and sex grouping.
- To quantify the inhibition of the extract of the peel of Carica Papaya (baby) at 3% on the growth of Streptococcus Mutans before, at 10 minutes and 8 days of use in the experimental group.
- Quantify the inhibition of 0.12% Chlorhexidine Gluconate on the growth of Streptococcus Mutans before, after 10 minutes and 8 days of use in the control group.
- Compare the count of Colony Forming Units (CFU) between both groups.

primary_outcome.time_frame: thorough study completion, an average of 24 hours

intervention.description: Each application was 10 ml. applied for 1 minute, once a day for 8 days
Each application was 10 ml. applied for 1 minute, once a day for 8 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants that signed the informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- allergic to carica papaya
- ongoing medical or dental treatment that could interfere with the results.

facility.name: Facultad de Odontología Universidad Nacional de Caaguazú

link.description: Zaragoza MT, Benitez V. Actividad antimicrobiana del Papacárie® contra Streptococcus Mutans asilado de saliva. Odonto Pediatr [Internet]. 2012;1(3):18-22.

reference.citation: Saliasi I, Llodra JC, Bravo M, Tramini P, Dussart C, Viennot S, Carrouel F. Effect of a Toothpaste/Mouthwash Containing Carica papaya Leaf Extract on Interdental Gingival Bleeding: A Randomized Controlled Trial. Int J Environ Res Public Health. 2018 Nov 27;15(12). pii: E2660. doi: 10.3390/ijerph15122660.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Writting and Publication Department, Regional Health Research Institute

patient_data.ipd_time_frame: From the time the protocol is available in clinical trials.gov and with no limit of time
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Researchers that want to know about the study and use the protocol
